wikipedia_page.main:
Lionel Raleigh Holland (22 March 1865 – 25 May 1936) was a British politician, the youngest son of Henry Holland, 1st Viscount Knutsford. He was elected as a Conservative Member of Parliament for Bow and Bromley in 1895. He resigned in 1899 by becoming Steward of the Manor of Northstead.

Represented Westminster on the London County Council 1895–8.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1895 United Kingdom general election
response: *27 October: Bow and Bromley - Walter Murray Guthrie, Conservative, replacing Lionel Holland

link_mentions.page: List of members of London County Council 1889–1919

response: Guthrie was elected to the Commons in the 1899 Bow and Bromley by-election, defeating the Liberal candidate Harold Spender by 2,123 votes and succeeding the Conservative MP Lionel Holland. He kept the seat of Bow and Bromley in the general election the next year. He left Parliament in the 1906 general election and was succeeded by the Liberal Stopford Brooke.
